column4: I'm a Linux newbie.  When I add a file system, where can I find its contents?
Where's "My Computer" for crying out loud?
when you say "Add filesystem", do you mean a device (like a flashdirve)?
k. when you plug a flashdrive in, an icon should come up on the desktop.
What if I'm not using a gui?
These sound like "Windows" instructions :)  Tell me what to type.
you have to find the device's "name" (don't know what its called): ls /dev
then you have to do "sudo mkdir /media/flashdrive" and then "sudo mount /dev/sdb1", replacing "/dev/sdb1" with whatever the device "name" is
I see why you said, "just double click it" :)
yeah ;) that's why I don't really use terminal-only computers :P
ah got it. I found it out once, but know my VBox is borken. It won't install new kernel modules, so can't help you there. But, try googling "ubuntu guest virtualbox shared folder"
If my VBox works, I can get it for you. But i can't ;(
Thanks.  Why won't it install new kernel modules? What do you mean by new?  New to the vbox or new as of some point in time?
basically,compiled new kernel, so it have to recompile it with some blah, and more blah :/ I have to recompile it (my kernel).
